intro: Phlomoides setifera, commonly known as the slender phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Phlomoides setifera is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
